data.title: Fine Arts Events
data.meta_description: Fine Arts Events - Stevenson High School
data.text:
Acting

Dec. 12, 2020: Acting 3 Showcase - "Written in Quarantine"

Our Acting 3 Showcase - "Written in Quarantine" was held Saturday, Dec. 12 from 5:00-6:00 p.m. This virtual, fun-filled, show included original slam poems, musings on the pandemic, and improv comedy. Performances were streamed on Zoom.

Band

May 20, 2021: Spring Band Awards Concert

On Thursday, May 20 at 7 p.m. the Stevenson Band Program hosted the Spring Band concert, virtually via Vimeo, featuring pre-recorded performances by the students. Band sections represented include: Freshman Band, Concert Band, Symphonic Band, Advanced Symphonic Band and Honor Band. Senior awards were also presented during this virtual event.

View Concert Program

March 31, 2021: Virtual Spring Band Concert

On Wednesday, March 31 at 7 p.m. a virtual showcase of pre-recorded performances by the students of the Stevenson High School Band Program was streamed via Zoom. Five different pieces of music were performed, featuring over 400 students from Freshman Band, Concert Band, Symphonic Band, Advanced Symphonic Band and Honor Band.

Dec. 10, 2020: December Virtual Band Concert

On Thursday, Dec. 10 at 7:00 p.m, each of the five levels of our band program hosted virtual performances. This concert included previously unseen solo and chamber performances from the semester. Performances were streamed via Zoom.

Benefit Concert

April 17, 2021

The SHS Tri-M Music Honor Society is held a benefit concert teaming up with Crescendo for a Cause, a local, Stevenson alumni-ran, non-profit organization with the mission of improving music education in underserved areas through fundraising, donating, and performing. The event took place on Saturday, April 17 at 7:00 p.m. through a YouTube Premiere. The concert will featured performances from the Tri-M members. The goal was to reach $500. Thank you for joining!

Choir

May 19, 2021: Spring Choral Concert

Our culminating choir concert of the year, featured both pre-recorded and live-streamed moments honoring our students, and especially, our 2021 graduating seniors!

This virtual performance streamed via Vimeo, Wednesday, May 19 at 7 p.m. All Stevenson choral ensembles were featured: Curricular choirs are Stevenson Choir, Advanced Choir and Patriot Singers. Co-curricular groups are Low Frequency, Polyphonics and Nothing But Treble.

The concert also included a special tribute to seniors and showcased songs we learned during the second semester.

View Concert Program

Jan. 11, 2021: Consortium 125 Choir Night

The Stevenson Choir Department hosted their annual annual Consortium 125 Choir Night for all 8th grade students interested in learning more about choir at Stevenson on Monday, Jan. 11 at 7:00 p.m. via Zoom. The event featured music, info sessions and fun games. Please contact Alice Nuteson (anuteson@d125.org) for more information and help with any questions.

Download Flyer

Dec. 13, 2020: December Choir Concert

The Virtual Choir Concert, originally scheduled for Friday, Dec. 11, was rescheduled and streamed on Sunday, Dec. 13 at 7:00pm.

View the concert program

The December Choir Concert was held on Sunday, Dec. 13 at 7:00 p.m. This virtual event featured our curricular and co-curricular choirs singing ensemble pieces they have learned during semester one remote learning. We ended the evening with a special original commissioned piece by composer Paul Langford, with text by Maya Angelou, titled "Open Your Eyes." Many thanks to the Stevenson Choral Guild and the Stevenson Fine Arts Department for their support making this commission possible! Performances were streamed on Vimeo.

Nov. 6, 2020

The Fall Choir Collage Recital was streamed on Nov. 6, 2020 at 7:00 p.m. Watch the performance.

Guitar

March 15, 2021: Guitar Chamber Concert

On Monday, March 15 at 7 p.m., the guitar chamber concert virtually showcased quartets and quintets of student performances. Students picked, rehearsed and recorded their pieces independently and were excited to showcase their work! Concert streamed on Vimeo.

View Concert Program

Orchestra

March 10, 2021: Senior Solo Recital

There was a showcase performance of four selected senior soloists for the 2020-21 school year on Wednesday, March 10 at 6:00 p.m.

Soloists:

Bella Kim, Viola

Lana Zeller, Violin

Haoming Song, Cello

Connor Friedman, French Horn

View Program

Strings

May 11, 2021: Strings Outdoor Concert

There was an outdoor concert on the front lawn of Stevenson for all of our Guitar and Orchestra classes, Tuesday, May 11 at 6 p.m. Participating classes included: Guitar I, Guitar II, Patriot Guitar Ensemble, Stevenson Orchestra, Symphonic Orchestra, Concert Orchestra and Patriot Orchestra. There was also an awards concert for all the Orchestra and Guitar students at this time.

This was a "Ravinia-style" event where families could bring blankets and chairs to come watch and support their students! Attendees followed social distance guidelines and wore masks at all times. For those who couldn't join in person, the concert was streamed via Vimeo.

View the event program.

May 7, 2021: Baroque Ensemble Concert

On Friday, May 7 the Baroque Ensemble performed a virtual concert via Vimeo featuring works by Corelli, Bach and Vivaldi. Check out a preview of the performance.

View the performance program.

Feb. 25, 2021: Strings Winter Concert Showcase

The Guitar and Orchestra classes virtually presented small solo and chamber setting performances on Thursday, Feb. 25 at 7 p.m. to benefit our String Parent Association’s (SPA) "4 Weeks of Giving" fundraising effort. Performance videos were collected throughout the year, and therefore, some featured our musicians in warmer, outdoor settings. Pieces were announced live during the showcase. Performance streamed via Zoom.

Feb. 17, 2021: Strings Chamber Concert

On Feb. 17 at 6:00 p.m., students in in Symphonic and Patriot Orchestra class performed a virtual showcase via Zoom. This concert was our student small group chamber performances featuring trios, quartets, quintets, and sextets that chose their own music. All groups were virtually coached by professional music chamber coaches - Emma Strohbusch, Renee Henley, Nazar Dzhuryn and Morgan Little.

Strings Chamber Concert Program

Jan. 14, 2021: Strings Consortium Concert

The Strings department hosted a special virtual version of their annual Consortium event on Thursday, Jan. 14 at 7:00 p.m. This event was for 8th grade students and their families interested in joining SHS guitar and orchestra classes in the fall of 2021. It was a fun and informational evening! Zoom link invitations were provided by school directors.

Jan. 12, 2021: Strings Winter Concert

The Strings department showcased the amazing musical work of each guitar and orchestra class during this one night virtual concert. Held on Tuesday, Jan. 12 at 7:00 p.m. on Vimeo, this event featured the best and brightest of our strings program in the debut of their first semester recording projects!

Theatre

April 29 - May 1, 2021: Patriot Theatre Company Virtual One Act Plays 2021

Join us as we celebrate our annual One Act Plays through the Patriot Theatre Company, produced entirely virtually for the second year in a row! These plays are entirely student written, directed, acted, designed and produced. From comedy to murder mystery and musicals... the One Acts represent a diverse body of work and talent from our practically professional student theatre artists!

The "Reading Series" will take place on April 29 at 7 p.m. and will include plays produced as staged readings.

The "One Act Plays" will be performed April 30 and May 1 at 7 p.m. as fully produced virtual productions, some pre-recorded and some live!

Click this Zoom link or scan the QR code to join us!

View the event program for more information.

March 5-7, 2021: The Compass

Performances of "The Compass" were held Friday, March 5 at 7 p.m., Saturday, March 6 at 2 p.m., Saturday, March 6 at 7 p.m., and Sunday, March 7 at 2 p.m. "The Compass" was a groundbreaking, live interactive performance that explored the intersection of technology and decision-making. The audience interacted with the actors through optional virtual breakout rooms and audience polls.

At the center of "The Compass" was a trial, determining the fate of a teenager who used an app to make a life-altering decision. In this play, every show ended differently, depending on what the audience decided as the jury. The audience joined us as we navigated the question: When someone else, or something else, tells you what to do, what exactly are you responsible for?

This play was recommended for mature audiences only, as it confronted such issues as racism and school violence.

View "The Compass" Program

Feb. 12-14, 2021: Almost, Maine

The Freshman/Sophomore play, "Almost, Maine." was streamed online on Friday, Feb. 12 at 7 p.m., Saturday, Feb. 13 at 2 p.m., Saturday, Feb. 13 at 7 p.m. and Sunday, Feb. 14 at 2 p.m. This multimedia production was filmed in a series of locations and the entire cast and crew was comprised on Stevenson freshmen under the direction of Theatre teacher Joey Fitzpatrick.

November 20-22, 2020: Disney's Newsies

Streamed performances: Nov. 20 at 7 p.m., Nov. 21 at 7 p.m. and Nov. 22 at 2 p.m.

Access to reserve tickets will begin on Nov. 2.

Oct. 24-25, 2020: OLIVÉRio: A Brazilian Twist

OLIVÉRio streamed on Oct. 24 at 2 p.m. and 7 p.m. and Oct. 25 at 2 p.m.

Please visit this online ticketing site to receive your free access code to stream this production.

Theatre - Improv

Feb. 5, 2021: The Failed Presidential Candidates, Live Virtual Comedy Show

The Failed Presidential Candidates hosted a live virtual comedy show on Friday, Feb. 5 at 7:00 p.m. Twenty-seven of Stevenson's funniest students made up an entire performance, never to be seen again! This show was appropriate for audiences of all ages. Performance was streamed via Zoom.

Youth Arts Month

March 11, 2021: The Arts Connect Us, Youth Arts Month

Stevenson’s Fine Arts Department celebrated Youth Arts Month with a virtual presentation at 7 p.m. on Thursday, March 11. The presentation featured student performances and creative highlights from each area of our programs: Music, Theatre, Dance, and Visual Art. Performances were streamed via Vimeo.

The evening featured collections of artwork and montages of performances created during Fall 2020’s Remote Learning semester. Works included:

Patriot Theatre Companies' performances of Newsies, Oliverio and Failed Presidential Candidates Improv.

Collections of music and artwork from scenic design, sound design, music production and visual arts classrooms.

Performances from Dance 3 classrooms, Repertory Dance Company and Mélange Dance Company.

Performances by Patriot Orchestra, Concert Band, Freshman Band, Stevenson Orchestra Chamber Ensemble and all Stevenson choirs in a collaborative finale.

View Youth Arts Month Program

Visual Arts

May 17- 31, 2021: Consortium ArtFest

The annual Consortium ArtFest celebrates the artistic and creative work from our K-8 Consortium and Stevenson High School students. The visual arts provide all students the opportunity to explore their creative potential using a variety of media for diverse purposes and audiences.

While this year will be quite different from years previous, this virtual event reflects our continued commitment to showcase our students’ artistic growth and achievements!

The exhibit is available now through Monday, May 31. Click the flyer on the right for links to each school. We hope you and your family will attend!
